Package com.peterphi.std.guice.testing.com.peterphi.std.guice.testing.annotations

Annotation Interface GuiceConfig

@Target(TYPE) @Retention(RUNTIME) public @interface GuiceConfig
Annotation that describes how to customise the test environment for a test run with GuiceUnit

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    boolean
    autoLoadRoles
    If set to false then GuiceRoles will not be automatically loaded using the Service Provider Interface.
    Class[]
    classPackages
    Recursively scan the package containing the named classes
    String[]
    config
    The configuration resources to search for in the classpath
    String[]
    packages
    Recursively scan the listed packages
    Class<? extends GuiceRole>[]
    role
    The GuiceRole classes to instantiate and register when building the guice environment.
    Class<? extends GuiceSetup>[]
    setup
    The (at most one) GuiceSetup instance to use.

  • Element Details

    • config

      String[] config
      The configuration resources to search for in the classpath
      Returns:
      Default:
      {}

    • packages

      String[] packages
      Recursively scan the listed packages
      Returns:
      Default:
      {}

    • classPackages

      Class[] classPackages
      Recursively scan the package containing the named classes
      Returns:
      Default:
      {}

    • setup

      Class<? extends GuiceSetup>[] setup
      The (at most one) GuiceSetup instance to use. If not specified then an empty BasicSetup will be used. The class named here must have a no-argument constructor.
      Returns:
      Default:
      {}

    • role

      Class<? extends GuiceRole>[] role
      The GuiceRole classes to instantiate and register when building the guice environment. The classes named here must have a no-argument constructor.
      Returns:
      Default:
      {}

    • autoLoadRoles

      boolean autoLoadRoles
      If set to false then GuiceRoles will not be automatically loaded using the Service Provider Interface. Any desired roles must then be manually managed through role()
      Returns:
      Default:
      true
